Money Map to Freedom Program from Alexis Neely ($997 Normally)
90min Private iRest Session (and Recording)--an evidence-based practice for improving sleep and reducing stress with Ren Resch (2 of 2 remaining)
Chiropractic Adjustment for you and your pet with Jason Orowitz (2 of 2 remaining)
90min Relationship Coaching Session with Jayson Gaddis (value $225) (0 of 1 remaining)
1hr Massage with Sheena Creed (1 of 1 remaining)

1hr Coaching session on building authentic community with Sara Ness (1 of 1 remaining)

Acupuncture Session with Custom Herbal Formula with Marco Lam (1 of 3 remaining)

Chiropractic Session with Dr. Richard Kronen (3 of 3 remaining)

1hr Enneagram Consultation by skype with Josh Levin (2 of 2 remaining)

Home Aesthetic Consult with Erin Needham - Need someone to help you arrange and decorate your home in a way that supports your mental and spiritual health? Erin can evaluate your home décor and develop a plan that will align your home space with artistic appeal and functional utility on nearly any budget. (1 of 1 remaining)

1.25 Hour Leadership or Business Coaching Session by Skype with Jason Gore jasongore.com (Value $600) (1 of 1 remaining)

One 2-hour Business Consultation session with Jack Spivak: Business Consultation: Visioning, Strategic Planning, Strategic Messaging. (1 of 2 remaining)


One hour high level Business Consulting with Steven Ringelstein (value $1000) (0 of 1 remaining)

One session (phone/in-person) on "The Power of Pausing - A Truth-Speaking Practice for Women" with Jess Nichol
Set of 2 Eating Psychology coaching sessions with Kimba Kjolhede (1 of 1 remaining)

90min massage with Merideth McNown (1 of 1 remaining)

3 hours of massage, acupuncture, and integrated personal training with David Moore.  Can be used all at once or split into 3 sessions. (0 of 1 remaining)
Set of 3 Integral Polarity Therapy sessions with Maya Hill (2 of 2 remaining)

2 hours of green building consulting with Mark Bloomfield (Expertise in energy efficiency, net zero homes, building science, indoor air quality, residential mechanical systems) (1 of 1 remaining)

Set of 3 hour-long Breema bodywork sessions with Jamie Furstoss Lam (1 of 1 remaining)

One couples coaching session with Sujana Palazzo (1 of 1 remaining)

Set of two 1-hour psychotherapy sessions with Reuvain Bacal (1 of 1 remaining)

Women's yoga kit (2 75-minute videos) and women's meditation kit (6 downloadable audios) from Sara Avant Stover (1 of 1 remaining)

Original art by Bryce Widom  (3 of 3 remaining)  -  #1   http://bit.ly/UFTX1q  -  #2   http://bit.ly/UFTTik  -  #3   http://bit.ly/SNa0si

90min NLP Changework Coaching session with Kendra Current (1 of 1 remaining)

Set of 2 hour-long productivity coaching sessions with Mihai Banalescu (0 of 1 remaining)
Private yoga/movement/meditation session with Brooke McNamara (1 of 1 remaining)
Circling training session with Ryu Koyama (1 of 1 remaining)
Web content consultation with Keith Martin-Smith. This would include a phone call/meeting about someone's online brand, and some specific content suggestions and rewrites for improving their offering. (1 of 1 remaining)
$300 - Entry or Scholarship to our New Year's Practice Gathering: Scenius, Dec 28th - Jan 1stAt the end of this year, many members of our community--local and global--will be joining us for 4 days of practice and celebration, Integral style.  Led by Integral Center lead teachers, Diane Musho Hamilton and Decker Cunov, this party is not to be missed.  By contributing at this level, you get a discounted entry ($495 full price) to this year's Scenius for yourself, as a gift, or to sponsor a full scholarship for someone who wouldn't normally be able to attend.  Read more about the event here.$500 - Entry or a Sponsored Scholarship to our flagship training:Aletheia ~ Integral Relating Intensive, for half the normal priceOur flagship practice weekend in Boulder gives every participant an opportunity to benefit from and learn our Integral relating practice, circling.  The success of this training was one of the reasons we were able to grow to where we are today.  By contributing at this level, you're welcome to join any of our upcoming Aletheia weekends (normally $995), give it as a gift, or have a full scholarship available in your name for an applicant that wouldn't normally be able to attend.  Aletheia trainings weekends are four times per year.  Learn more about Aletheia here. $750 - Discounted Year Long Membership for You or as a Sponsored ScholarshipA 12-month membership to the Integral Center for you, as a gift, or as a scholarship sponsored in your name. Being a member of the Integral Center in Boulder gives premium access to all of our classes on top of many other benefits. More importantly than that, it allows you to be immersed in a community of people who want to wake-up and grow-up together; this is the best way we know to optimize personal growth and development.  Membership is normally $85/month.  Learn more about Integral Center Membership here.$1000 - Join a Year-Long Advisory Circle with Monthly Conference CallsWant to ensure the job is getting done and your perspectives are integrated? For all of 2014, you'll join private monthly calls with principles of the Integral Center to evolve and further integrate the vision and business plan. Like an Integral share-holder meeting, we'll review finances, project metrics, partnerships, and anything else necessary to make sure we're on track with your help.$3000 - Day-long "Inner Journey" with Decker Cunov (Limited to 3, 2 remaining)This is a special opportunity to have a day-long private session with Integral Center lead teacher, Decker Cunov and two other participants.$5000 - A Private, Small-group Meeting with Ken Wilber (Limited to 10)A private, small-group meeting with Ken Wilber at his loft in Denver to discuss the Integral vision and more. This is a very rare opportunity to meet with the author and philosopher that all of Integral theory and practice stands on the shoulders of. We'll determine dates based on what's best available for the group.$10000 - Your ChoiceAngels of this high order get to choose one from the following:

Full access and use of the Integral Center for a weekend to host whatever you want.


A weekend in Boulder spent however you want. We'll be your hosts to practice, party, philosophize, etc.


We'll organize a private day-long circling event for a group of your choice: family, coworkers, friends, etc.


A community service project of your choice in Boulder.  We'll gather a group of IC members and go to work for a day or so on a project you choose or we find on your behalf.

The Impact - More Care and Consciousness, Role-Modeled Locally, Enabling Greater Care and Consciousness GloballyThe money raised in this campaign will go directly to rebuilding our center and improving our ability to resource our community locally and beyond.  The success of this campaign will not only enable us to rebuild our building, but it will strengthen our community and all the lives it touches.   This isn't just about a physical space, it's about the intentions that this space holds, which is capable of helping the world. If we reach our goal, we’ll be able to rebuild and improve what we had before AND build-out new additions that will support the community's health and sustainability for years to come.  We'll have space to create a beautiful new embodiment studio, build a commercial kitchen for community meals, and new office spaces for member rentals. Rebuilding our space allows us to host more community events and enable even greater levels of community fitness and maturity -- healthier relationships, broader sharper minds, emotional maturity, and deeper consciousness.  Our community is enriched and nourished by the wide variety of offerings hosted at our center and by the informal relationships that are formed and shaped along the way.Other Ways You Can HelpWe want everyone who feels inspired by our story and mission to participate, monetarily or otherwise! Here’s how you can help other than financially:
We need new furniture!  Help us track-down donations or find great deals.

Spread the word about the good work we do and share our campaign with people you know.  Contact us if you want to learn more about who we are.

Pay us a visit, come to an event, or send us a message to setup a conversation if you want to learn more.
If you're a Boulder local, come join the rebuild parties, and see more of what we're doing.

story:
Short Summary 

Aloha! My name is Cameron Kalani hauoli Lovleace.  I have the only Skateboard Shop on our island and recently opened a indoor skatepark for the youth of the island. I provide a safe place for skaters to master the tricks without worrying about getting into trouble.  I also, have skate lessons for beginners to learn proper techniques.  Its been 2 months and I'm already feeling the strain of the rent and maintenance.  I need to keep this going!! for the youth and skaters on my island. I have 60 days to turn it around to keep this skatepark open.

What We Need

I will use the funds to cover rent, maintenance, insurance, lumber and materials.

The funds will by me some time to rally up local and corporate sponsors in the skateboard industry to help cover my monthly expenses.

The Impact

The main goal in this project providing a positive atmospher for the youth of the island.

You will know that more youth will be out of trouble occupying there minds with a positive activity.

I've been in business for 3 years building the skateboard scene here and plan to keep it going for future generations.

Other Ways You Can Help

spread the word

follow me 

@yesikauai     Instagram 

facebook.com/yesiskateshop 

www.yesikauai.com

story:
It's the Final Countdown.  14 Hours left and lots left to raise!  Can't wait to get those perks sent out to everyone so you can come and treat yourself for helping out!!!!



Update:  I have had a few private donations and on here as well from really neat people who believe in me, which feels amazing.  I have been able to get a few items nessesary to get clients in my space.  It's getting there, but still so far to go.  

People are booking appointments, which is fantastic, but I talk to people every day and they have explained to me their conditions that prevent them from doing what they want or need to do on an every day functioning level, and then they sigh as to turn away because of cost.  I let them know that we can get through it together.  This is what I am here to do.   

I, recently,  received quality care at a very affordable cost in a timely manor,  and all I could think about is how just that one effort saved me in such a crucial time.  Truly a life saver.  I want that for my clients. 

Hello Everybody!

     I am Emily, and am a Licensed Massage Therapist (LMT) in the great state of Illinois.  I am enthralled to work and grow as a therapist and practice in my state and community. In 2002 I attended massage therapy school at an academy in Phoenix, AZ.  Graduating at the top of my class in 2003 I aspired for more.

Since this time, I have passed the National Certification Board of Massage Therapy exam to practice in state and am working on my National Certification in Massage Therapy and Body Work to gain accreditation nationally.  I have also trained in a variety of continuing education courses around the country, and continue to extend my knowledge base, indefinitely.  

So, why am I doing this campaign.  Well, to put it straight I have worked so very hard to get to this point.  10 years ago the laws started to change for massage therapists and since I choose to come back home to Illinois I was no longer grandfathered into a license.  Self-study and determination is all I had and have to uphold the highest standard in this field.  In essence I am thankful that I have had to go down this road as it has only made me exceed my own expectations.  There has been much sacrifice to this point and now I need to hit the ground running.  This isn't another thing to wait on.  The need to get started now goes above and beyond my wants and needs.  Therefore, I am here.

The fund goal to be raised will go towards everything from insurance, studio rent, advertising, table, products, etc.  This is the minimum budget for a therapist to get a base foundation.  The perks that are being offered, in return, are better than what I will be offering for first time clients.  So, there are definite benefits to helping out.  Anything raised above my goal will be put aside for my future aspirations. 

 I am developing a life long project of integrating another passion of mine, bringing family and community connection, into my therapy base.  The aspiration is to bring affordable yet diverse body work therapy into the lives of all individuals and families as a whole.

Awareness, education, and hands on is a foundation that I believe I can accomplish this integration with.  I hope to bring to light, providing all 3 of these elements to my clients every session, the foundation that our means of vitality starts with One, and with One change comes Another, and so forth.  The vision is you, your partner/spouse, your child/children, your family, your community, and so forth.

As things grow there will be different programs to take advantage of as a client.  More ways to become involved in a long term dedication to your health and others around you such as workshops, products, connections, and financial assistance for therapy.  These being only a few of many long-term goals.

In any fashion, my appreciation of you even visiting this page is great.  Thank you for taking the time to read.  I look forward to the future.

story:
Short Summary

"This is the first generation that is going to live less than their parents" and the saddest thing is that all of these deaths are totally preventable .

Meet Ubaldo (the one in the picture), a a ten year old Mexican boy. He weights 76,6 kilos with a height of 145 centimeters. He has a BMI of 36,5 and was diagnosed with chronic severe obstructive sleep apnea hypopnea, Metabolic Syndrome X and acanthosis nigricans. In the picture he is at the emergency room in the Federico Gomez Children Hospital in Mexico City for symptoms related to Morbid Obesity. Ubaldo is one of thousands of children facing problems like this not only in Mexico but in the whole world. 

I am a doctoral researcher and this is my topic. My goal is to provide solutions to avoid unnecessary deaths at young ages. My target population are children. 

Children are the most vulnerable individuals to publicity and marketing strategies, since they cannot really tell the difference between reality and publicity and they don't have a strong capacity of changing their environments. 

They are constantly bombarded by marketing professionals selling them unhealthy products so why not to use these same proven strategies  to promote a healthier nutrition? This project aims to show the children and their parents that plain water flavored with natural fruits and herbs is not only healthy but also delicious, easy to prepare and visually attractive. This strategy is holistic, involving parents, schools and other stakeholders.

Mexico is the biggest Coca-Cola drinker in the world and pace number 2 in children obesity. It is not uncommon to see children like Ubaldo everyday in the Hospitals. This picture was taken by Bénédicte Desrus in a mexican hospital, please refer to the acknowledgment below for more details about the picture case. Thanks Bénédicte for allowing me use this picture!

So, I made a team of people concerned with this topic and we designed a social marketing intervention trying to make an impact in children so they quit sugary drinks and change them for naturally flavored water. This would reduce their likelihood to develop diabetes type II in more than 80%


What We Need & What You Get

We want to create a module were children can taste this water, learn how to prepare it, propose their own mixes and exchange their sugary drinks for portable difusors so they can have always this kind of water with them. They will receive also flyers to take home with information for their parents and super easy instructions for improving nutrition at home. Everything will be accompanied by attractive mascots (a girl, a boy and a robot). All the strategies are based on behavioral economics strategies and are evidence based. 

We need to buy the difusors (initially calculating 100 pieces), fruits, herbs, rent a couple of chairs and tables, print the flyers, handouts and marketing material and also some working material that is bought only once such as glasses and jars. The cost of getting the module working for three days for the first time is 898 Euros. After that, the cost of every additional working day is 40 Euros (not considering additional difusors). We want to go to three schools at least and try the strategy. This will sum up to 2,000 Euros approximately. The more money we have, the more schools we can go or/and the more difusors we can give to the children.

What do you get? You can get copy of all the informational material, recipes for this water, personalized pro-good-nutrition counseling along with updates about the project. 


The Impact


Macro-setting

The project is design to provide evidence to the public health decision makers in Mexico about this social marketing strategies in the Mexican setting. Whether the intervention works or not, the result is valuable and must be communicated.  This information can be also useful for similar settings like most of Latin-america and countries from other continents. 

Micro-setting

If we get only one family to change their habits during the intervention, we would possibly save a life together (you contributors and everybody involved) for only 2,000 Euros. We really believe it is worth it a try!


Risks & Challenges

As in every behavior-related interventions there are certain sustainability risks, for example:

That the intervention does not create a sustainable change within the families

That the schools and other stakeholders support the strategy only during our presence there

That the children simply don't find it appealing

But as explained before, due to the low cost and potential positive outcome only if it is one children, We really believe it is worth it!


Other Ways You Can Help

Not being able to donate but still want to help? Sure! Thank you in advance!

Here is what you can do:

  • If you live in Mexico and want to volunteer for the implementation, send us a message through our Facebook page!
  • If you live in Mexico or other Latin-american country and you know a school that is interested in testing this approach, let us know through our Facebook page!
  • Give us more ideas of how to tackle obesity among children!
  • Give us recipes!
  • Share our posts in our Facebook page!

Thank you!!!

Acknowledgments: 

Photo courtesy of © Bénédicte Desrus / www.benedictedesrus.com

If you need any info. / captions about the photo.:

Mexico - Ubaldo and his mum, Yolanda Lopez. Ubaldo Alexis Garcia Lopez, a ten year old Mexican boy, is being treated by doctors at the emergency room in the Federico Gomez Children Hospital in Mexico City for symptoms related to Mordid Obesity. Ubaldo weights 76,6 kilos with a height of 145 centimeters. He has a BMI of 36,5 and was diagnosed with chronic severe obstructive sleep apnea hypopnea, Metabolic Syndrome X and acanthosis nigricans. He is a young student coming from a poor family living in Iztapalapa, one of the poorest areas in the Mexican capital. Obesity is a massive epidemic affecting countries around the world. Mexico has one of the highest obesity rates in the world, and public health officials are increasingly alarmed by the rapid rise in child and youth obesity. Mexico holds the first place worldwide in childhood obesity (at the moment of the picture). About one-third of children in Mexico are now classified as either overweight or obese. There is also a high prevalence of obesity among the poor in Mexico. Photo credit: Benedicte Desrus

story:
Running Is Not Supposed To Be Bad For You.

Every year 50-80% of runners are injured. That's a well-known statistic, one you've probably heard before. 

Behind those numbers, what does the day-to-day reality actually look like?

  • A person whose New Year's resolution was to start running. On January 1 their first run feels awful but they feel proud they did it, and believe it will feel better as they get fitter. On February 1 it still feels awful. On March 1 they're not running any more.

  • A runner who wants to try a marathon but can't ever seem to run more than 7 miles without knee pain.

  • A runner training for a marathon, hoping to set a new personal best, only to break down after an 18-miler and never make it to the starting line.

  • A runner who loves training with a club – having goals, structure, feedback, and the encouragement of teammates -- but frequently struggles with injury, missing workouts, races... and friends.

  • A lifelong runner who holds their body together with stretching, foam rolling, Pilates, sports massage, and visits to the physio, allowing them to train hard, race hard and occasionally sets PRs. But on the way to work in the morning they can't break into a run to catch a bus because it hurts too much.

The flip side of those stories is the smaller percentage of runners who have a very different experience:

  • Looking forward to every run because of how great it feels.

  • Easily increasing the length of runs without pain or injury

  • Arriving healthy at the starting line of a goal race and setting a PB with a smile

  • Training steadily with a club and being there to help teammates run better as well.

  • Recovering the joy, freedom, and spontaneity of running as a child, breaking easily into a run to catch a bus or race a grandchild.

Runners in the first group, working hard to take care of their bodies and cultivate their health and wellbeing, often think those in the second group are just lucky – born healthier or more biomechanically gifted than everyone else.

But no one was born knowing how to run. Every one of us learned how.

And while there are many factors involved in staying healthy and running well, learning is the only one that can make you feel fast, free, and a little like you're flying. Running, that is, like you were born to.


The Discovery

I'm not a coach or sports scientist. My background is in professional dance, so when I struggled to run, I did what dancers do: I looked for problems with my technique and started working on them.  

That was in 2001, long before the book "Born to Run" sparked the barefoot/minimalist running movement and raised interest in working on running form (or technique). So I didn't have much to go on. But I did have a powerful tool to help me: the Feldenkrais Method of Movement Education.

The Feldenkrais Method was developed by Moshe Feldenkrais, D.Sc., beginning in the 1950s to help people learn how to move and function better. Not just a sports-training method, it's known for helping people with serious challenges, such as cerebral palsy, multiple sclerosis, and strokes, and even can be used to help animals. It allows people to dramatically improve how they move safely and without stress.

As I was studying to become a Feldenkrais practitioner, I was able to use the method to make dramatic changes in how I ran until it felt fantastic. In fact it felt better than dancing and I decided to make the switch.

I also realized that the things I'd discovered were critical to running the way nature intended were things nobody else was talking about, let alone teaching effectively. That's when The Balanced Runner was born.

Since then, along with two Feldenkrais practitioners I’ve trained, I have helped hundreds of runners one-to-one and in workshops, and countless others via my YouTube channel, online courses, and my blog. 

But it isn't even a drop in the bucket. And running technique education, though much more popular now than in 2001, hasn't improved nearly enough. This means huge numbers of runners are getting hurt and frustrated unnecessarily every year – some even to the point of giving up their efforts to be physically active, despite all we know about the tragic effects of a sedentary lifestyle.
Even more significantly, it means countless runners every year trying and failing to connect to this most basic human action, this powerful, natural means of cultivating our best selves in body and mind and deepening our relationship with the beautiful world we live in.

I want to help more runners. I believe it’s time for the Feldenkrais Method to become part of the mainstream, so that every runner who needs help will hear about it and be able to use it.

I can do that by massively expanding my online offerings and training running-related professionals to use what I’ve discovered. But to do that I need administrative and IT staff.  The goal of this campaign is to raise the funds to hire them.


FAQ

How is this approach different from doing stretches or strength training or core stability exercises?

Most physical therapists and fitness professionals recommend exercise to help runners improve their technique. However stretches, Pilates, etc., may change your strength or flexibility but they don't help you learn how to move better. That process, called “motor learning,” requires a combination of exploration and feedback that's missing from most exercise.

The fact is, your flexibility and mobility are determined by your nervous system, which is constantly making decisions about how much to lengthen or shorten your muscles and how to coordinate your movement, and this determines which muscles get strong when you run. That process of making decisions and coordinating your movement is what needs to be improved to help you run better, and this will result in better flexibility, mobility, and strength... not the other way around.

Strengthening and flexibility exercises can be good cross-training for runners provided they're done correctly, but they just don't make a big enough difference in running technique.

How is this different from running technique drills and cues?

As with exercise, drills and cues lack the exploration and feedback features required for learning. They aren't harmful but they lack the power to make significant changes in how you run.

Won't the right shoes and/or orthotics solve most problems?

The American College of Sports Medicine – the largest and most respected advisory organization on health and fitness in the US – says they will not. Their current guidelines state, "A running shoe should protect the feet against injury, but should not do the work of the foot by providing excessive cushioning and lots of extra support in the arch. A shoe should complement a strong foot." 

Based on a thorough review of the existing research on running shoes, the ACSM recommends you avoid shoes with motion control or stability components, as well as extra arch support inserts or store-based orthotics because they interfere with normal foot motion. "Orthotics should be considered temporary fixes (<6-8 weeks)..." 

In other words, you should not depend on your footwear to be an ongoing solution for running-related problems. 

Won't switching to minimalist footwear or barefoot running solve most problems?

Many people feel it does, though research is not conclusive at this point. However, most experts recommend you transition gradually from conventional running shoes to minimalist or barefoot running, and as part of your transition you work on your running form. So changing your type of footwear still means you need an effective method for learning better running technique.

How is this different from other running technique programs, such as ChiRunning, Pose Method, etc.?

The Balanced Runner is the only company using an effective scientifically-based motor-learning method to help runners improve their technique. Other methods depend primarily on drills, cues, and exercises to help runners change their technique, and thus are less effective for the reasons listed above.

What's your proof?

The Balanced Runner has a 12 year track record of success. Clients regularly set new personal bests shortly after beginning to work with us and experience their pain fading away, all more rapidly than training or healing could bring about. 

Research into the Feldenkrais Method includes this study showing the method lengthens hamstrings without stretching and this one that shows it improves balance and balance confidence in the elderly. However to date there are no studies into the use of the method to help runners or to understand the specific running technique changes that come about. Such studies are expensive, and initiating the process is a stretch goal for this campaign.


The Balanced Runner Has Been Featured In:


The Balanced Runner is Ready to Help Runners Worldwide

I've spent nearly 15 years total – nearly 13 professionally – discovering the key movements involved in running and the teaching strategies that help runners learn them quickly and safely. Eight of those years went into developing, testing, revising, and testing again an online running camp that can transform most runners in 4 to 6 weeks – about as long as an average course of physiotherapy or couch-to-5k program, for the price of a couple of pairs of trainers (and much less than a pair of custom orthotics!).


What We Can Accomplish Together

My aim is nothing short of transforming the way the world understands and experiences running so we can reclaim this human birthright.

When you back this campaign, not only will I thank you with a perk that begins your transformation, you'll also be helping The Balanced Runner grow. Reaching our funding goal means I'll be able to hire the administrative and IT help necessary to  offer The Balanced Runner Online Running Technique Camp to 10 times as many runners as in 2015. 

If we pass our goal there is so much more we can accomplish. Additional money raised will go towards:

1. An experienced travel/retreat coordinator so we can offer running workshop retreats in the Scottish Highlands.

2. The administrative help and legal/professional services needed to create certification programs for professionals so more coaches, physiotherapists, fitness professionals, and Feldenkrais practitioners will know how to help runners in a truly effective way.

3. Developing a program to help sedentary kids get outside and love running.

4. Initiating scientific research into the effects of the Feldenkrais Method on running economy and recovery from running injury.


Timeline


Choose your perk to start transforming your running! If you're a Feldenkrais practitioner, running coach, physiotherapist, yoga or fitness instructor, or other professional who works with runners, be sure to check out the perks designed to help you use the insights from The Balanced Runner in your own professional practice:  The Pro's Starting Line and The Pro Camp + Master Class.

Do you live outside the US? Not sure how to make a contribution in dollars when that's not your currency? No worries, Indiegogo will convert your currency to dollars, there's nothing special you need to do. So go ahead and choose your perk!

SELECT A PERK


 Be sure to use the buttons to the left to share the campaign on social media and with your friends. One of the most helpful things you can do to help is to spread the word.

Thank you so much!
story_txt:
Running Is Not Supposed To Be Bad For You.Every year 50-80% of runners are injured. That's a well-known statistic, one you've probably heard before. Behind those numbers, what does the day-to-day reality actually look like?
A person whose New Year's resolution was to start running. On January 1 their first run feels awful but they feel proud they did it, and believe it will feel better as they get fitter. On February 1 it still feels awful. On March 1 they're not running any more.
A runner who wants to try a marathon but can't ever seem to run more than 7 miles without knee pain.
A runner training for a marathon, hoping to set a new personal best, only to break down after an 18-miler and never make it to the starting line.
A runner who loves training with a club – having goals, structure, feedback, and the encouragement of teammates -- but frequently struggles with injury, missing workouts, races... and friends.
A lifelong runner who holds their body together with stretching, foam rolling, Pilates, sports massage, and visits to the physio, allowing them to train hard, race hard and occasionally sets PRs. But on the way to work in the morning they can't break into a run to catch a bus because it hurts too much.
The flip side of those stories is the smaller percentage of runners who have a very different experience:
Looking forward to every run because of how great it feels.
Easily increasing the length of runs without pain or injury
Arriving healthy at the starting line of a goal race and setting a PB with a smile
Training steadily with a club and being there to help teammates run better as well.
Recovering the joy, freedom, and spontaneity of running as a child, breaking easily into a run to catch a bus or race a grandchild.
Runners in the first group, working hard to take care of their bodies and cultivate their health and wellbeing, often think those in the second group are just lucky – born healthier or more biomechanically gifted than everyone else.But no one was born knowing how to run. Every one of us learned how.And while there are many factors involved in staying healthy and running well, learning is the only one that can make you feel fast, free, and a little like you're flying. Running, that is, like you were born to.The DiscoveryI'm not a coach or sports scientist. story: Eight years ago our mum was diagnosed with a number of incurable auto immune diseases, two of which are life threatening. After many treatments including biological drugs and chemo therapy she has been told that she Only has two options. First being a High daily dose of chemo therapy for the remainder of her life, which will make her deteriorate even more (in which the NHS will fund) or a Life Saving Stem cell transplant, but due to the NHS refusing to give the treatment for free, we ask all our friends and family and anyone who wants to help us in raising £22,000 to fund the treatment to give our mum The best possible chance of recovering. thank you!

story:
The last days are on. Please take this opportunity to make a difference today and change a child’s life forever.

In South Africa today, many children are born without the ability to smile. Some are born with birth deformities preventing them from smiling and even breathing normally.

South Africa’s Smile Foundation is committed to making a difference in the lives of many children; living with treatable facial anomalies such as facial paralysis, Cleft Lip and Cleft Palate. Through donations the foundation provides them with re-constructive surgery. 

In acknowledgement of 15 years since it launched in South Africa, the Smile Foundation with our support as Novancia students in Paris has launched a campaign to not only increase awareness about the organisation but also help raise funds for many children still in need of these surgeries.

“I am humbled that South Africa’s Smile Foundation has been chosen from charities across the globe to be the recipient of this initiative. Because of Novancia, children with facial conditions will have the opportunity to receive life changing reconstructive surgeries. These students may never meet the children but the opportunity they will be given will change their future forever.” Hedley Lewis Fundraising & Financial Executive Director at South Africa’s Smile Foundation. 

Thank you kindly for your support.

Any questions or queries regarding the South African Smile Foundation can be directed to Ms Toni Jabour, Marketing Manager of the Smile Foundation.

Land-line telephone: +27 11 325 6480 or 0861 276 453.

story:
Side effect: Weight loss

When we enrolled 100 overweight and obese people into a clinical study, "The chronic health project", it was NOT ABOUT WEIGHT LOSS.  These guys had focused for years on losing weight and never did (not for long, at least). Now they found themselves dropping their dress size while they actually pursued something else:

An individualized path to chronic health and functional longevity.

So we investigated why. And we made an amazing discovery: the human ability to master a 6th sense for calorie balance. Training it was a side effect of our study intervention.

Now we want to bring that side effect to everybody. With a GPS for chronic health. Globally available like the GPS you use in your car. Only with a different purpose: to create the first epidemic that everyone would like to have - the epidemic of chronic health and waist reduction.

The prototype GPS is ready for our contributors to try out its first feature: training a 6th sense for calorie balance. Your contributions will help us to improve the design and to translate our research results into the add-ons for chronic health and longevity. For everybody.

But first, let me show you why and how we think we can make this fly. And be prepared for a few surprises.

Why would you need a health GPS?

Because your path to health is littered with the traps and temptations of a powerful calorie cartel. It operates with a simple business model: making money by making us fat. And that's the same as making money by making us sick. That's how overweight has become the single largest cause of death and disease. That's why we need a GPS to navigate around those traps. Without having to abstain from whatever makes life so enjoyable.
 

Why do we call it ELF?

ELF stands for Evidence-based Longevity Finder.

As health scientists we know that longevity is a consequence of staying free from chronic disease: heart disease, stroke, diabetes and many cancers. They do not come with growing old. They are the wrong sort of growing old. Which you can avoid with the two most powerful interventions known to biomedical science: the physical activity and the dietary behaviors which exactly match YOUR biological profile.

So, we build this GPS to help you find your personal path to chronic health. A path which is strictly built on biomedical evidence. Which is why we called it the Evidence-based Longevity Finder, the ELF.




Why are we focused on weight?

We are not. As our study participants realized, on the path to chronic health and longevity weight loss is a side effect. But that's a good one, for two reasons: (a) most people desire it and (b) overweight has already become the single largest cause of avoidable disease and death. That's why we made training a 6th sense for calorie balance the ELF's first feature.

 

How does this 6th sense for calorie balance work?

Calorie balance is a 5-dollar word for a five-cent equation: calories-in minus calories-out. The result is what you see on your scale. Only, you see it too late.

With a 6th sense for your daily calorie balance you keep the calorie-in and calorie-out behaviors  intuitively on track to your weight goals. And therefore to your health goals. For good.


Why do we need your financial support?

Because we are about $37,000.- short of developing our tool into a "Global health Positioning System -- GhPS".

As health scientists we have spent our own money over the past 4 years to:

  • set up and run adiphea's health lab
  • do the basic clinical research on how to make people achieve chronic health
  • translate our findings into the first testable application

 

Other ways you can help

We are really grateful for every kind of support, not only the financial sort. It would help us greatly to get the word out about our project. For example:

  • to your employer: to use the ELF in a pilot corporate health project, for example. We are ready to go all the way with him.
  • to your fitness club: they might want to introduce it to their members
  • to your newspaper editor: for being the first to talk "chronic health"
  • to your congress (wo-)man: chronic health is a subject of national importance
  • to your health insurance company: they definitely love healthy policy holders
  • to Oprah Winfrey: she might just give the "side effect" a try
  • to your friends and family: for the same reason
  • maybe not to your mother-in-law: or are you implying that she is fat?


What will we do with your support?

First off, we strongly believe in reciprocity: if we receive something valuable, we give something valuable in return. Which is why we wanted to have a testable prototype when we go asking for investments. We let our contributors use this prototype for one year for free. We also offer a few other perks which are not usually available. Now, let us tell you what your contributions will be spent on:

I.     Phase 1 (target completion: 31. July 2012): from prototype to product

  • building the "Wow" into the web delivery of the ELF ($ 9,500.-): You'll see that the ELF works, but you'll also see that it needs some serious face lifting. The $ 9,500 go to the creative people who make the design and to the IT people who translate that design into a web application which keeps its users attracted to staying the course towards chronic health.
  • Upgrading the server to accommodate the expected traffic increase ($ 1,500.-): We have been running the ELF as a sideshow on one of our partner's private virtual server. For the expected increase in user traffic, this temporary solution is seriously underpowered. So we need to migrate the ELF to its own dedicated server.
  • developing algorithms for medium-term and lifetime risk profiling ($ 3,000.-) from users' individual medical and physiological data: you have probably heard about risk scores for heart disease and diabetes. The problem is that they are too myopic, too much focused on the next 10 years and therefore missing out on real lifetime risk. Which is what we want to remedy. That requires analyses of published and  unpublished research data, and the translation of these data into algorithms which let the ELF calculate your true lifetime health and risk profile. I'll write more on this subject in the updates to this campaign.
  • Improving the training algorithm for the 6th sense tool ($ 3,000.-): The purpose of this algorithm is to detect whether your 6th sense is really developing or whether you are just guessing right by chance. While the algorithm is good, we have some ideas about making it more sensitive. And we need to check out this idea in real subjects.
  • Buying MatLab Software ($ 4,000.-) to do all the algorithm developments: MatLab software is the math software which we need to work our algorithms and to evaluate the data from physiological measurements done on our study subjects. Until now we have been piggybacking on the academic resources of one of our collaborators. But we want to find ourselves back on the right side of the copyright laws. Which is why we have to make the expense.

     II.     Phase 2:   

  • developing algorithms to project the trajectories of biological aging (3,000.-): Wouldn't it be nice to know how you age in comparison to what is normal or ideal for your age and gender? And to know how to decelerate your aging process? We know this is  possible, because we have been working on the data. But we need to translate these data into computer algorithms for the ELF to give you the feedback based on your input.
  • validating the aging algorithms on real study subjects ($ 5,000.-): It's the grunt work which is necessary to verify the algorithms described above. The real costs for such studies are many multiples of what we are asking here. But we are not calculating our own work, we are simply asking you to help us cover the expenses which go to subject recruitment, consumables and maintenance for testing equipment.
  • Improving the algorithm for predicting weight development ($ 3,500.-): the ELF not only trains your 6th sense for calorie balance, it also alerts you to your organism's rousing defense against your weight loss attempts. We believe we can predict when this defense system is going to strike you with a "feeding frenzy". We need to refine our current algorithm, which is not yet sensitive enough, and we need to test this, again in real subjects.
  • Producing an iphone app for the 6th sense tool ($ 5,000.-): That's one of the most often voiced criticism of the ELF users among our study subjects: Make it operational on the mobile phone. So, the first app to develop is one for the iPhone. The money goes to the developers of this app.

What will you get in return?

First off, you'll be investing into the bright future of preventive care. In time to come this project could be celebrated as the first and definitive step towards the age of chronic health and longevity. And your name will be attached to it, as one of the privileged few who helped to shape this vision into reality. 

That's why we will eternalize every contributor's name on a designated page on our site. The Chronic Health Wall of Fame. 

We reward contributions of $ 50.- and above with the 12-months ELF package consisting of a one-year free use of the ELF for one or more persons and an invitation to join as a study participant. Participants' progress will be monitored, and occasional feedback will be given by the study investigator, Dr. Lutz E. Kraushaar.

Here are the perks in summary:

$ 10 - The Inspired: A personal "Thank You" note and mention on the Chronic Health Wall of Fame as the truly Inspired.

$ 50 - The Motivated: A personal "Thank You" note, mention on the Chronic Health Wall of Fame as the Motivated sponsor, plus a 12-months ELF package for 1 person. That person may be you or someone who you want to give the gift of chronic health.

$ 88 - The Enthusiast: A personal "Thank You" note, mention on the Chronic Health Wall of Fame as the Enthusiast that you are, and a 12-months ELF package for 2 persons. Your enthusiasm is contagious and that's a good thing. Because when it comes to changing health behaviors, people always do better in pairs or in groups than alone. Not only because it is fun co compare (or to compete?), but because everyone occasionally needs a friendly urging-on.

$ 188 - The Sponsor: if you would like to get a small group started on their journey to chronic health here is the deal: a 12-months ELF package for 5 persons, plus, of course, your mention as a Sponsor on the Chronic Health Wall of Fame.

$ 318 - The Patron: Your ambition to change lives is your gift to your club, group, church or organization. With a 12-months ELF package for 10 persons, and your mention on our Chronic Health Wall of Fame as what you are: the Patron

$ 500 & above - The Evangelist: Twenty 12-months ELF packages plus one additional package for every 25 Dollars exceeding your $ 500 contribution. If you want this for more than a hundred of your club's members or your organization's employees, talk to us directly, so that we may assist you. In any way, your name and picture will be immortalized on our Chronic Health Wall of Fame as the consummate Health Evangelist.

 

What - or who - is adiphea?

adiphea is short for

"Alliance for DIsease Prevention and HEalthy Aging".


Alliance because it is open for all - be it individuals, companies and organizations - who sincerely pursue the quest for chronic health and longevity.

Disease Prevention because the only cure for chronic disease is prevention.

Healthy Aging because that's how Mother Nature intended aging to be.
story_txt:
Side effect: Weight loss
When we enrolled 100 overweight and obese people into a clinical study, "The chronic health project", it was NOT ABOUT WEIGHT LOSS.  These guys had focused for years on losing weight and never did (not for long, at least). Now they found themselves dropping their dress size while they actually pursued something else:
An individualized path to chronic health and functional longevity.
So we investigated why. And we made an amazing discovery: the human ability to master a 6th sense for calorie balance. Training it was a side effect of our study intervention.
Now we want to bring that side effect to everybody. With a GPS for chronic health. Globally available like the GPS you use in your car. Only with a different purpose: to create the first epidemic that everyone would like to have - the epidemic of chronic health and waist reduction.
The prototype GPS is ready for our contributors to try out its first feature: training a 6th sense for calorie balance. Your contributions will help us to improve the design and to translate our research results into the add-ons for chronic health and longevity. For everybody.

But first, let me show you why and how we think we can make this fly. And be prepared for a few surprises.

Why would you need a health GPS?


Because your path to health is littered with the traps and temptations of a powerful calorie cartel. It operates with a simple business model: making money by making us fat. And that's the same as making money by making us sick. That's how overweight has become the single largest cause of death and disease. That's why we need a GPS to navigate around those traps. Without having to abstain from whatever makes life so enjoyable.
 

Why do we call it ELF?
ELF stands for Evidence-based Longevity Finder.
As health scientists we know that longevity is a consequence of staying free from chronic disease: heart disease, stroke, diabetes and many cancers. They do not come with growing old. They are the wrong sort of growing old. Which you can avoid with the two most powerful interventions known to biomedical science: the physical activity and the dietary behaviors which exactly match YOUR biological profile.
So, we build this GPS to help you find your personal path to chronic health. A path which is strictly built on biomedical evidence. Which is why we called it the Evidence-based Longevity Finder, the ELF.



Why are we focused on weight?
We are not. As our study participants realized, on the path to chronic health and longevity weight loss is a side effect. But that's a good one, for two reasons: (a) most people desire it and (b) overweight has already become the single largest cause of avoidable disease and death. That's why we made training a 6th sense for calorie balance the ELF's first feature.
 
How does this 6th sense for calorie balance work?
Calorie balance is a 5-dollar word for a five-cent equation: calories-in minus calories-out. The result is what you see on your scale. Only, you see it too late.
With a 6th sense for your daily calorie balance you keep the calorie-in and calorie-out behaviors  intuitively on track to your weight goals. And therefore to your health goals. For good.



Why do we need your financial support?
Because we are about $37,000.- short of developing our tool into a "Global health Positioning System -- GhPS".
As health scientists we have spent our own money over the past 4 years to:

set up and run adiphea's health lab
do the basic clinical research on how to make people achieve chronic health
translate our findings into the first testable application

 


Other ways you can help
We are really grateful for every kind of support, not only the financial sort. It would help us greatly to get the word out about our project. For example:


to your employer: to use the ELF in a pilot corporate health project, for example. We are ready to go all the way with him.

to your fitness club: they might want to introduce it to their members

to your newspaper editor: for being the first to talk "chronic health"

to your congress (wo-)man: chronic health is a subject of national importance

to your health insurance company: they definitely love healthy policy holders

to Oprah Winfrey: she might just give the "side effect" a try

to your friends and family: for the same reason

maybe not to your mother-in-law: or are you implying that she is fat?


What will we do with your support? 
First off, we strongly believe in reciprocity: if we receive something valuable, we give something valuable in return. Which is why we wanted to have a testable prototype when we go asking for investments. We let our contributors use this prototype for one year for free. We also offer a few other perks which are not usually available. Now, let us tell you what your contributions will be spent on:
I.     Phase 1 (target completion: 31. July 2012): from prototype to product 


building the "Wow" into the web delivery of the ELF ($ 9,500.-): You'll see that the ELF works, but you'll also see that it needs some serious face lifting. The $ 9,500 go to the creative people who make the design and to the IT people who translate that design into a web application which keeps its users attracted to staying the course towards chronic health.

Upgrading the server to accommodate the expected traffic increase ($ 1,500.-): We have been running the ELF as a sideshow on one of our partner's private virtual server. For the expected increase in user traffic, this temporary solution is seriously underpowered. So we need to migrate the ELF to its own dedicated server.

developing algorithms for medium-term and lifetime risk profiling ($ 3,000.-) from users' individual medical and physiological data: you have probably heard about risk scores for heart disease and diabetes. The problem is that they are too myopic, too much focused on the next 10 years and therefore missing out on real lifetime risk. Which is what we want to remedy. That requires analyses of published and  unpublished research data, and the translation of these data into algorithms which let the ELF calculate your true lifetime health and risk profile. I'll write more on this subject in the updates to this campaign.

Improving the training algorithm for the 6th sense tool ($ 3,000.-): The purpose of this algorithm is to detect whether your 6th sense is really developing or whether you are just guessing right by chance. While the algorithm is good, we have some ideas about making it more sensitive. And we need to check out this idea in real subjects.

Buying MatLab Software ($ 4,000.-) to do all the algorithm developments: MatLab software is the math software which we need to work our algorithms and to evaluate the data from physiological measurements done on our study subjects. Until now we have been piggybacking on the academic resources of one of our collaborators. But we want to find ourselves back on the right side of the copyright laws. Which is why we have to make the expense.

     II.     Phase 2:   


developing algorithms to project the trajectories of biological aging (3,000.-): Wouldn't it be nice to know how you age in comparison to what is normal or ideal for your age and gender? And to know how to decelerate your aging process? We know this is  possible, because we have been working on the data. But we need to translate these data into computer algorithms for the ELF to give you the feedback based on your input.

validating the aging algorithms on real study subjects ($ 5,000.-): It's the grunt work which is necessary to verify the algorithms described above. The real costs for such studies are many multiples of what we are asking here. But we are not calculating our own work, we are simply asking you to help us cover the expenses which go to subject recruitment, consumables and maintenance for testing equipment.

Improving the algorithm for predicting weight development ($ 3,500.-): the ELF not only trains your 6th sense for calorie balance, it also alerts you to your organism's rousing defense against your weight loss attempts. We believe we can predict when this defense system is going to strike you with a "feeding frenzy". We need to refine our current algorithm, which is not yet sensitive enough, and we need to test this, again in real subjects.

Producing an iphone app for the 6th sense tool ($ 5,000.-): That's one of the most often voiced criticism of the ELF users among our study subjects: Make it operational on the mobile phone. So, the first app to develop is one for the iPhone. The money goes to the developers of this app.

What will you get in return?
First off, you'll be investing into the bright future of preventive care. In time to come this project could be celebrated as the first and definitive step towards the age of chronic health and longevity. And your name will be attached to it, as one of the privileged few who helped to shape this vision into reality. 
That's why we will eternalize every contributor's name on a designated page on our site. The Chronic Health Wall of Fame. 
We reward contributions of $ 50.- and above with the 12-months ELF package consisting of a one-year free use of the ELF for one or more persons and an invitation to join as a study participant. Participants' progress will be monitored, and occasional feedback will be given by the study investigator, Dr. Lutz E. Kraushaar.
Here are the perks in summary:
$ 10 - The Inspired: A personal "Thank You" note and mention on the Chronic Health Wall of Fame as the truly Inspired.
$ 50 - The Motivated: A personal "Thank You" note, mention on the Chronic Health Wall of Fame as the Motivated sponsor, plus a 12-months ELF package for 1 person. That person may be you or someone who you want to give the gift of chronic health.
$ 88 - The Enthusiast: A personal "Thank You" note, mention on the Chronic Health Wall of Fame as the Enthusiast that you are, and a 12-months ELF package for 2 persons. Your enthusiasm is contagious and that's a good thing. Because when it comes to changing health behaviors, people always do better in pairs or in groups than alone. Not only because it is fun co compare (or to compete?), but because everyone occasionally needs a friendly urging-on.
$ 188 - The Sponsor: if you would like to get a small group started on their journey to chronic health here is the deal: a 12-months ELF package for 5 persons, plus, of course, your mention as a Sponsor on the Chronic Health Wall of Fame.
$ 318 - The Patron: Your ambition to change lives is your gift to your club, group, church or organization. With a 12-months ELF package for 10 persons, and your mention on our Chronic Health Wall of Fame as what you are: the Patron
 $ 500 & above - The Evangelist: Twenty 12-months ELF packages plus one additional package for every 25 Dollars exceeding your $ 500 contribution. If you want this for more than a hundred of your club's members or your organization's employees, talk to us directly, so that we may assist you. In any way, your name and picture will be immortalized on our Chronic Health Wall of Fame as the consummate Health Evangelist.
 
What - or who - is adiphea?

adiphea is short for
"Alliance for DIsease Prevention and HEalthy Aging".

Alliance because it is open for all - be it individuals, companies and organizations - who sincerely pursue the quest for chronic health and longevity.
Disease Prevention because the only cure for chronic disease is prevention.
Healthy Aging because that's how Mother Nature intended aging to be.

story:
Save A Young Life

He's only 17 and is facing something none of us even want to dream about.
 

What's happened so far?


The story has been picked up by local media.  We've even had Edin Dzeko the Manchaster City striker donate 50,000 KAM which is about 25K EUR.

The total amount needed is around 146K Euro.  Edin is actually helping again by setting up a local charity game from which all funds will go towards Alen's recovery fund.  You can find more info here:  http://sportsport.ba/blabla/dzeko-ovo-je-utakmica-za-zivot/82229

 

What I am trying to do

So far Alen has received well over 50,000 EUR in donations.  All of this was done through direct payments to his family, Western Union & Wire Transfers.  I am hopping that having a platform such as this will allow everyone to donate easier and hopefully we can raise what's left to pay for Alen's recovery.

story:
Hi!

My name is Ford!

It is with joy that I am finally going to take my CrossFit Kids Trainer Certification, Thank god for persistence, I am a certified CrossFit-L1 Trainer now!

This brings me forward to being able to journey onwards into doing CrossFit Kids. I've always loved movement, and the sport of fitness is evolving. After nearly 11 years in the education industry - working with children, still is a passion - and what better way than to do so through my own sport: CrossFit.

If you would like to contribute to my travel fund - it would be really nice of you to do so. Even if not - thank you for chancing upon this page!

Wish me luck!
Thank you.

F

story:
Several of you may be aware that I have been suffering from untreated and misdiagnosed Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) for years.

For the past year and a bit, I have been working on the commitment to myself, to more actively address the pain and difficulties I encounter on a daily basis. Although I have been able to do much on my own (both past and present), I have been unable to fully address the issues that haunt me and hold me back from fully becoming who I am meant to be. For this I need some outside assistance. Someone to help guide me, hold me accountable, and cheer me on with tackling and overcoming my seemingly insurmountable obstacles.

I am on the wait-list for several Vancouver Coastal Health Authority and Vancouver Family Services, programs. However, the wait is long, while I do what little I can to keep the wolves at bay.

The Choices Seminars (http://choicesseminars.com/seminars/seminars) were recommended to me by someone that has been through them, and is somewhat familiar with what I have been going through. The program may seem drastic/intense, but after more than 25 years of this, I am more than ready to step away from the pain of barely surviving - and move into the joy of living.

This is where I find myself needing to ask for a different type of help. To put it simply, I am on disability and totally strapped for cash. If you are able to help me in away way, whether that is through a donation (of even $1) or sending me your love and support, I would be exceedingly grateful.

story:
The Need

The United States provides the best healthcare in the world, but only if you can afford it. Everyday Americans die because they lack access to care. We have the best healthcare technology, but our healthcare system produces some of the worst health outcomes. In fact, out of all the countries in the world, our system ranks number 37!

The U.S. healthcare system does rank number 1 in having the greatest disparities in access in the developed world. The rich get care; the poor are more likely to get sick and die. This is the only developed country where you can have health insurance and still go bankrupt due to non-covered expenses from a medical illness.

You probably know someone who suffered because of not being able to afford to see the doctor, or was kicked off his or her health plan, or had a terrible experience with a private insurance company. We won’t take it anymore! That is why the California Health Professional Student Alliance (CaHPSA) fights every day to achieve healthcare justice by advocating for a new and improved Medicare for All.

Medicare is good everywhere, lets you see any doctor anywhere, is not tied to your job, covers most costs of care, and since 1965 has guaranteed that our seniors over 65 get the care they need. We want to improve it, expand it and give it to everyone! Healthcare should be a social service, not a commodity available only to those who can afford it.

What is CaHPSA

The California Health Professional Student Alliance (CaHPSA) is a statewide student-run organization comprised of thousands of student-activists who fight to make sure no one else dies because he or she lacks access to health care. We are the California chapter of the national group, Students for a National Health Program (SNaHP).

Each year we select a stellar team of student fellows and train them in public speaking, community organizing, education and advocacy. Our goal is to empower the future leaders of the healthcare equality movement in California and the country.

Why You Should Donate!

Your generosity will change the lives of our young leaders by helping fund their one-year fellowships as statewide representatives of CaHPSA. Traditionally these students dedicate time to CaHPSA on top of their hectic classroom schedules in medicine, public health, nursing, law, biology, social work, kinesiology, occupational therapy and many other fields. They volunteer to lobby and rally for healthcare equality at the Capitol and local City Halls, to plan conferences to teach/mobilize their peers and to host campus debates to showcase that healthcare is a basic human right.  

Your support means the world to CaHPSA, a program many students say has opened their eyes and changed their lives. You are not only building strong leaders, but also helping to improve our community and the lives of those who desperately need access to quality, affordable health care.

Help Us Fund Our PASSIONATE Student Fellows

Help us reach our goal of $10,000 which would allow us to provide monthly stipends for our student fellows to give them financial support to plan and carry out their activities as advocates for healthcare reform.

NorCal and Socal Chairpersons (2 Fellows)

The two chairpersons are crucial to CaHPSA. Each facilitates and organizes local CaHPSA chapters in their region, seeks mentorships with campus faculty, and acts as a liaison between the CaHPSA statewide program coordinator and the student chapter leaders. The NorCal and Socal Chair will each receive a monthly stipend of $100 for 12 months from this campaign.

Campus Chapter Leaders (12 Fellows)

Campus Chapter Leaders organize, educate and outreach with students on their college campuses and are responsible for campus-wide events. These students are the community organizers and grassroots leaders that spread the message of healthcare equality across the state of California. Chapter Leaders will receive a monthly stipend of $50 for 12 months.

The IMPACT

The projects organized by CaHPSA aim to revolutionize our current healthcare system and improve it dramatically. While Obamacare has helped a lot of people, some 30 million nationwide will still be left uninsured. We want you and your loved ones to benefit from a system in which each and every one of us has the opportunity to get the best healthcare possible. We can get there by improving and expanding Medicare to cover everyone.

Your donations to CaHPSA will help accomplish this by training future healthcare leaders, educating our communities about health care inequality and building the movement for Medicare for All.  We will not stand idly by as people die! With an unyielding fire in our hearts, and a little help from you, we will make our healthcare system truly number 1, for everyone.

Past projects:

1. Annual Lobby Days for Healthcare Justice in Sacramento

2. Annual Regional Conferences on Healthcare as a Human Right

3. Healthcare Justice Marches to Sacramento, LA City Hall, Berkeley Civic Center Union

4. Demonstrations Against For-Profit Insurance Companies Denying Care

5. Hosting Campus Debates about solutions for our healthcare crisis.

Future Goals:

1.  Double our student chapters.

2.  Double student participation in our Annual Lobby Days.

3.  Increase our student membership by 2,000 students.

Other Ways You Can Help

As "starving students" ourselves,  we understand if you are not able to help us with a donation; however, please help us spread the word about our IndieGoGo campaign via Email, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, or any other platform you use. Social change only happens when we fight for it. You all have what it takes to help make our healthcare system better. A little act will go a long way. 

In Solidarity, 

CaHPSA

story:
Hi there,


My journey with Pilates began as a rehabilitation/cross training regimen.  A few years ago, I suffered a severe foot injury, leaving me unable to walk properly let alone dance.  After physical therapy, I was still not fully recovered, and I was searching for the missing link.

A wonderful role model and teacher, Hannah, introduced me to Pilates and literally got me back on my feet, and back to doing what I love- dance!  This experience opened up a plethora of opportunities and I want to share my passion for creative expression and movement by helping other dancers gain awareness of their bodies and recover from injury, or better yet- injury prevention!  

Since my full recovery, I have continued my Pilates practice.  I have had the opportunity to participate in Ballets, aerial training and continue on my path in good health with my newfound awareness of my body and it's individual needs.

The Goal: $6,000

  • This covers the full intensive certification program, which includes mat work and the Reformer.  
  • A little bit goes a long way.  Your contribution could help cover the cost of the required the courses and/or the required textbooks.  I'm  grateful for any amount you can give- every dollar helps!

The Impact

I would love to specialize in helping dancers stay in peak form, however I am also interested in teaching individuals from all walks of life.  With my strong background in dance combined with Pilates certification, I believe I could make a difference.
I have always loved teaching, and have been working with children from fifth grade through high school, in two languages- I believe this will further enrich my Pilates instruction. 
Pilates aims to put the body in perfect balance- making this a great exercise for anyone with any body type. Pilates increases body awareness, core strength, body control and decreases chronic neck pain.  I think anyone can benefit from that!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!  As mentioned earlier, a little bit goes a long way.  The more people who are aware of my campaign, the more likely it is for me to reach my goal!  A heartfelt THANK YOU in advance!

Happiness and Health,

Danielle
